chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Christopher T. Levendoski was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Probation agent Canady appeared.  Letter received from Julie Battersby from WCS.  No further comment from any party.  Deft will be allowed to discharge from committment on 2/22/16.  Order signed by the court.

to be released to his father's custody

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Conditional release plan received.  All parties concur with the recommendations.  Conditional release is granted and order; court adopts the recommendations contained in the report.  Appeal rights.  Credit 140 days.  Deft may be released to his father's custody.
Conditional Release Plan
Order for Conditional Release Plan - Form CR-274

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Cafferty.  Court orders a conditional release plan to be prepared w/in 21 days.  FP set for 5/11/15 @ 11am.
File sent to Br 3 for signature - Form CR 274.

Order of Commitment
Form CR-271

After conclusion of court hrg, Judge instructed the clerk to contact Atty Cafferty to inform him that he will need to speak with the jail regarding the release of the deft to his father for transportation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft withdraws his plea of not guilty and enters a plea of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on all three counts.  Deft is committed to the Dept of Health Services for a period of 14mos on conditional release.  Conditions of release - no weapons in his possession, take all medications as prescribed/ordered, & follow all rules or regulations.  This order shall commence on 4/23/15.  Atty Cafferty requests that the deft's father be allowed to pick him up from the jail tomorrow and transport him.
Filed by Atty Patrick Cafferty
Amended Info

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Pat Cafferty.  Case is resolved.  Amended misd. information filed.  Brief discussion held.  Report has been received which states the deft is now competent to proceed.  Parties stipulate to the findings contained in the report.  Balance of plea hrg adjourned to 4/22/15 @ 2:30pm.
from Dr. McGlynn
Competency hearing on April 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Report of Adra McGlynn, licensed psychologist at Mendota Mental Health Institute.
Of Commitment for Treatment (Form CR-206)

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Patrick Cafferty.  Report from Dr. Rawski received.  Attys concur with the report.  Deft briefly questioned by the court.  No further evidence presented.  Court follows the recommendations of Dr. Rawski including the administration of medications.  Deft is committed for a period of one year or until he becomes competent.
For Competency

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Patrick Cafferty. Clerk LE. Atty. Matt Perz was appointed by SPD's Office, but def. has retained Atty. Pat Cafferty. Atty. Perz is releived of further duty. Atty. Cafferty raises the issue of competency. Probable cause found. Court orders competency evaluation under 971.14 to be performed in-patient by the Milwaukee Forensic Unit. Report to be filed within 15 days. Competency evaluation on 1-27-15 @ 3:00pm. Bond continued.
Matt Perz
